UNPOPULAR OPINION: You don't always need to replace all 4 tires.

The tire industry pushes "replace all four" as gospel. Sometimes it's true. Often it's not. Here's the actual science:

‚úÖ REPLACE ALL FOUR WHEN:
- You have AWD (tread depth difference damages transfer case‚Äî$3,000 repair)
- Remaining tires have less than 4/32" tread (mixing new with worn is unsafe)
- Wear pattern shows alignment/suspension issues (fix the problem first)

‚úÖ REPLACE TWO WHEN:
- You have FWD/RWD (not AWD)
- Other tires have 5/32"+ tread remaining  
- Damage is isolated to one axle
- You put new tires on the REAR (yes, even on FWD cars‚Äîprevents oversteer)

‚úÖ REPLACE ONE WHEN:
- Sidewall damage on nearly new tire
- Other three are within 2/32" tread depth
- We can match exact tire model and size
